journal_name: International Journal of Advanced Computing and Mechanical Systems

articles.title: Design of a Trapdoor-Enabled Symmetric Scheme for Secure Ciphertext Discovery
articles.abstract: This paper presents a novel symmetric encryption scheme with trapdoor functionality enabling authorized parties to efficiently search encrypted data. The proposed approach combines lattice-based cryptography with searchable encryption techniques to achieve both security and practical search efficiency. Experimental results demonstrate significant improvements in search time compared to existing methods while maintaining IND-CCA security.

articles.title: Entity-Driven Design for Secure Identity Administration
articles.abstract: We propose an entity-driven design framework for identity administration systems that enhances security through distributed trust models. The framework implements role-based access control with dynamic permission assignment, reducing attack surfaces by 40% compared to traditional systems.

articles.title: Prognostic Maintenance Modeling in Resource-Constrained Wireless Sensor Architectures
articles.abstract: This research develops a prognostic maintenance model optimized for resource-constrained wireless sensor networks. The model uses lightweight machine learning algorithms to predict equipment failures with 92% accuracy while consuming 60% less energy than existing approaches.

articles.title: Statistical Signal Occupancy Detection in Smart Wireless Systems
articles.abstract: We present a statistical method for signal occupancy detection in cognitive radio networks. The algorithm improves spectrum utilization by 35% through adaptive thresholding and Bayesian inference techniques.

articles.title: High-Efficiency Thermal Management Using Nanomaterial-Enhanced Heat Exchanger Designs
articles.abstract: This study investigates graphene-enhanced heat exchangers for high-power computing applications. Experimental results show 45% improvement in heat dissipation compared to traditional copper-based systems.

articles.title: Frictional Stability and Surface Integrity of Aluminum-Based Composite Materials
articles.abstract: We analyze the frictional properties of aluminum matrix composites reinforced with silicon carbide particles. The composites show 50% improvement in wear resistance while maintaining machinability for automotive applications.

articles.title: DEDUCT: A Secure Deduplication Framework for Textual Data in Cloud Environments
articles.abstract: DEDUCT is a novel framework for secure data deduplication in cloud storage. It employs convergent encryption with proof-of-ownership protocols, reducing storage requirements by up to 70% while maintaining data confidentiality.

articles.title: Detecting and Mitigating Botnet Attacks in Software-Defined Networks Using Deep Learning Techniques
authors.abstract: Software Defined Networking (SDN) has transformed modern network architectures by separating control and data planes, offering centralized management and enhanced flexibility. However, this centralization introduces security vulnerabilities, making the controller a prime target for botnet attacks. Such attacks flood the controller with malicious traffic, depleting resources and disrupting services. Traditional detection methods, reliant on static rules and basic machine learning, often fail to adapt to evolving threats, leading to high false alarm rates. To overcome these challenges, this paper proposes a deep learning–based framework for real-time botnet detection and mitigation in SDN. The system collects flow-level data from OpenFlow switches and employs Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN), Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM), and hybrid CNN–LSTM models to distinguish malicious from normal traffic. Upon detection, the controller enforces countermeasures such as flow rule updates, rate limiting, and node isolation. Evaluations using the CICDDoS and Bot-IoT datasets show improved accuracy, precision, recall, and F1-score, demonstrating the framework’s effectiveness in enhancing network security and resilience.
